description: Two very similar blocks of code.
Edulint: R6598 Duplicate blocks starting on lines 11 and 15. Extract the code to a helper function.（Emitted when there are duplicate blocks of code as a body of an if/elif/else/for/while/with/try-except block.）

description: Repeated occurences of the same (complex) expression.
Edulint: R6597 A complex expression 'XXX' used repeatedly (on lines X, X). Extract it to a local variable or create a helper function.

description: If-else statement with both branches being return True/False.
Pylint: R1703: The if statement can be replaced with 'return bool(test)' (simplifiable-if-statement)（Used when an if statement can be replaced with 'bool(test)'.）
Flake8:
WPS531 Found simplifiable returning `if` condition in a function（Forbid if statements that simply return booleans in functions or methods.）
WPS502 Found simplifiable `if` condition（Forbid simplifiable if conditions）
Edulint:
R6201 The if statement can be replaced with 'return number > 0（Emitted when the condition of an if statement can be returned directly (possibly negated).）
R6203 The conditional assignment can be replaced with 'redundant_check = <negated difference not in ['x', 'difference', 'n']>' [default]   （If-else statement with both branches being return True/False.）

description: Comparing a boolean expression to a boolean constant.
Pylint: C0121: Comparison 'x == True' should be 'x is True' if checking for the singleton value True, or 'x' if testing for truthiness (singleton-comparison)（Used when an expression is compared to singleton values like True, False or None.）
Flake8: E712 comparison to True should be 'if cond is True:' or 'if cond:'（When comparing a variable to True, you should use the form if x is True or simply if x. The most common incorrect form is if x == True.）
Edulint: E712 comparison to True should be 'if cond:' [default]

description: Comparing the same expression to multiple values.
Pylint: R1714: Consider merging these comparisons with 'in' by using 'x in (X, X)'. Use a set instead if elements are hashable. (consider-using-in)（To check if a variable is equal to one of many values, combine the values into a set or tuple and check if the variable is contained "in" it instead of checking for equality against each of the values. This is faster and less verbose.）
Edulint: R1714 Consider merging these comparisons with 'in' by using 'x in (1, 2, 3)'. Use a set instead if elements are hashable. [python-specific]

description: If clause with a condition that is always true.
Edulint: R6611 Use else instead of elif.(Emitted when the condition in elif is negation of the condition in the if.)

description: Variable that is defined but never read.
code example:
def main():
    a = 5
    # other code
    return 0
Pylint: W0612: Unused variable 'XXX' (unused-variable)(Used when a variable is defined but not used.)
Flake8: F841 local variable 'XXX' is assigned to but never used（A local variable in your function was defined but is not being used. This local variable should be removed.）
Edulint: F841 local variable 'name' is assigned to but never used [default]

description: Function parameter is never used in the body.
Pylint: W0613: Unused argument 'XXX' (unused-argument)（Used when a function or method argument is not used.）

description: Part of source code that is never executed.
Pylint: W0101: Unreachable code (unreachable)（Used when there is some code behind a "return" or "raise" statement, which will never be accessed.）
Flake8: WPS427 Found unreachable code（This is probably caused by return or raise statements. However, we cannot cover 100% of truly unreachable code by this rule. This happens due to the dynamic nature of python. For example, detecting that 1 / some_value would sometimes raise an exception is too complicated and is out of the scope of this rule.）
Edulint:
W0101: Unreachable code (unreachable)
WPS427 Found unreachable code

description: A statement that has no effect on execution.
Pylint: W0104: Statement seems to have no effect (pointless-statement)（Used when a statement doesn't have (or at least seems to) any effect.）
Flake8: WPS428 Found statement that has no effect（Refactor your code in case it was a typo or error or just delete this code.）
Edulint:
W0104 Statement seems to have no effect [default]
WPS428 Found statement that has no effect

description: The code contains commented out parts of code.
Flake8: E800 Found commented out code

description: A function that is defined but never called.
Nested if-statements avoidable using conjunction.
Edulint: R6207 The if statement can be merged with the nested one to 'if XX and XX:' [enhancement]（Emitted when the condition of an if statement can be merged with its nested if’s condition using logical operators.）

defect name: All If Branches Start/End with Identical Code
description: All if/elif/else branches start or end with the same code, which could be moved outside the condition.
Edulint: R6595 Identical code inside all if's branches, move * lines before the if.（Emitted when identical code starts or ends all branches of an if statement.）

description: Else clause containing just single if-else block.
Flake8: WPS513 Found implicit `elif` condition
Edulint: R6605 Use elif.(Emitted when the code contains else: if construction instead of elif. Might return a false positive if the code mixes tabs and spaces.)

description: Redundant branch containing just pass.
Edulint: R6205 Use 'if <negated c>: <else body>' instead of 'pass' [default]

description: Iterating through indices, only accessing items at the current index.
Edulint: R6307 Iterate directly: "for var in XXX" (with appropriate name for "var") [default]

description: While loop used when the number of iterations is known beforehand.
code example:
number = 0
while number < limit:
    print(number)
    number += 2
code fix example:
for number in range(0, limit, 2):
    print(number)
Edulint: R6305 You should use for loop instead of this form of while loop. (Emitted when a while loop can be transformed into a for loop.)

defect name: Changing the Control Variable of a For Loop
description: Changing a control variable of a for loop at the end of an iteration has no effect.
Edulint: R6304 Changing the control variable X of a for loop has no effect. [default]（Emitted when the control variable of a for loop is being changed.）

description: For loop with zero or single iteration.
Edulint: R6606 The for loop makes only one iteration.(Emitted when a for loop would always perform at most one iteration.)

description: Variable name i or j used when traversing items, not indices.
The code contains a variable named I, l, or O, which can be confusing.
Flake8: E741 ambiguous variable name（Variables named I, O, and l can be very hard to read. This is because the letter I and the letter l are easily confused, and the letter O and the number 0 can be easily confused.）
Edulint: E741 ambiguous variable name

description: The code uses function or variable names that are not in English.
NonEnglishNameDetector:
NE103 Non-English variable name: 'XX'
NE101 Non-English function name: 'XX'
NE102  Non-English  class name: 'XX'
NE104  Non-English. attribute name: 'XX'

description: Variable name conflicts with a built-in function name.
Pylint: W0622: Redefining built-in 'list' (redefined-builtin)（Used when a variable or function overrides a built-in）
Flake8: WPS125 Found builtin shadowing: list（Forbid variable or module names which shadow builtin names）
Edulint: W0622 Redefining built-in 'list' [default]

description: Functions with similar purpose have names using different naming schemes.
Function with more than 20 statements.
Pylint: R0915: Too many statements (**/20) (too-many-statements)
Edulint: R6702 Function 'XX' is too long (XX which is over 20 statements).

description: Program with more than 20 statements on the level of the main program (outside functions).
Edulint: R6701 Too much code outside of functions or classes (** which is over 20 statements).（Emitted when there are too many lines of code on the top level that are not import or function or class definition.）

description: The function has too many arguments.
code example:
def move(board, x, y, dir_x, dir_y, color):
   # body
code fix example:
def move(board, position, direction, color):
    # body
Pylint: R0913: Too many arguments (*/5) (too-many-arguments)
Flake8: WPS211 Found too many arguments: * > 5
Edulint: R0913 Too many arguments (* /5) [complexity]

description:
The Single Responsibility Principle may be ignored when
decomposing the code into multiple methods
Line with more than 100 characters.
Pylint: C0301: Line too long (1**/100) (line-too-long)
Flake8: E501 line too long (1** > 100 characters)
Edulint: E501 line too long (1** > 100 characters) [default]

description: An identifier contains non-ASCII characters.
Pylint: C2401: XXX name "XXX" contains a non-ASCII character, consider renaming it. (non-ascii-name)（Used when the name contains at least one non-ASCII unicode character.）
Flake8: WPS119 Found unicode name（Rename your entities so that they contain only ASCII symbols.）
Edulint: C2401 Argument name "X" contains a non-ASCII character, consider renaming it. [default]

Defect Group:
condAux = cond1 and cond2
condRes = condAux and cond3
description: The code contains more than one statement on a single line.
Pylint: C0321: More than one statement on a single line (multiple-statements)（Used when more than on statement are found on the same line.）
Flake8:
E702 multiple statements on one line (semicolon)（Multiple statements should not be on the same line separated by a semicolon. They should be on their own separate lines）
E701 multiple statements on one line (colon）（Multiple statements should be on their own separate lines. This improves readability.）
E704	Multiple statements on one line (def)（Multiple statements of a function definition should be on their own separate lines.）
Edulint:
E701 multiple statements on one line (colon) [default]
E702 multiple statements on one line (semicolon) [default]
E704	Multiple statements on one line (def)[default]

defect name: Magical Constant Instead of Character's Ordinal Value
description: Using a magic number instead of ord() for a character.
Edulint: R6615 Remove the call to 'ord' and compare to the string directly "< 'X'" instead of using the magical constant *. Careful, this may require changing the comparison operator. [default]

description: The code unnecessarily uses global variables.
code example:
global_list = []
def main():
    global_list.append("abc") 
    print(global_list)
    return None
main()
code fix example:
def main():
local_list = []
local_list.append("abc")
print(local_list)
return None
main()
Pylint: W0603: Using the global statement (global-statement)（Used when you use the "global" statement to update a global variable. Pylint discourages its usage. That doesn't mean you cannot use it!）
Edulint: R6401 Do not use global variables; you use count, modifying it for example at line X.

description: The code uses explicit open and close to manipulate a file, instead of using 'with'.
code example:
f = open("path.txt")
# work with the file
f.close()
code fix example:
with open("path.txt") as f:
    # work with the file
Pylint: R1732: Consider using 'with' for resource-allocating operations (consider-using-with)（Emitted if a resource-allocating assignment or call may be replaced by a 'with' block. By using 'with' the release of the allocated resources is ensured even in the case of an exception.)
Flake8: WPS515 Found `open()` used without a context manage（When you open() something, you need to close it. When using a context manager - it is automatically done for you. When not using it - you might find yourself in a situation when file is not closed and is not accessible anymore.）
Edulint: R1732 Consider using 'with' for resource-allocating operations [enhancement]

description: Mixing tabs and spaces.
Flake8: E101 indentation contains mixed spaces and tabs(Indentation has both tabs and spaces in it. Programmers should use either tabs or spaces, but not both.)
Edulint: E101 indentation contains mixed spaces and tabs

description: One-letter variable name.
Flake8: VNE001 single letter variable names like 'X' are not allowed
Edulint: WPS111 Found too short name: X < 2（Forbid short variable or module names.This rule checks: modules, variables, attributes, functions, methods, and classes. We do not count trailing and leading underscores when calculating length.）

description: The code uses an expression already tested for a specific value.
Sequence of commands (or blocks of commands) that are identical or differ by a single value.
Edulint:
R6552 There are * repetitions of 1 similar statements, which can be simplified using a loop. Consider iterating over 'range(*, *)'（Emitted when similar sequential blocks can be deduplicated using a loop.）
R6560 There are * repetitions of 1 similar statements, which can be simplified using a loop. Consider iterating over 'range(*, *)'(Emitted when similar sequential blocks can be deduplicated using a loop.)
R6553 The body of the loop contains duplicate blocks, starting on lines %s. Avoid the duplication by repeating the outer loop %s times.(Emitted when the body can be simplified using a loop and the extra iterations can be performed by iterating the outer loop more times.)

description: An if statement or loop has no effect.
Flake8: WPS328 Found useless node: for（Forbid meaningless nodes）
Edulint: WPS328 Found useless node: for

description: The code contains an identifier that does not follow naming conventions.
Pylint: C0103: XXX name "XXX" doesn't conform to XXX naming style (invalid-name)（Used when the name doesn't conform to naming rules associated to its type (constant, variable, class...).
Flake8:
N801 class names should use CapWords convention (class names)
N802 function name should be lowercase (function names)
N803 argument name should be lowercase (function arguments)
N804 first argument of a classmethod should be named ‘cls’ (function arguments)
N805 first argument of a method should be named ‘self’ (function arguments)
N806 variable in function should be lowercase
N807 function name should not start and end with ‘__’
N811 constant imported as non constant (constants)
N812 lowercase imported as non-lowercase
N813 camelcase imported as lowercase
N814 camelcase imported as constant (distinct from N817 for selective enforcement)
N815 mixedCase variable in class scope (constants, method names)
N816 mixedCase variable in global scope (constants)
N817 camelcase imported as acronym (distinct from N814 for selective enforcement)
N818 error suffix in exception names (exceptions)
Edulint: C0103 Function name "XXX" doesn't conform to snake_case naming style [default]

description: Consecutive if statements with the same body.
Edulint: R6596 Identical code inside 2 consecutive ifs, join their conditions using 'or'.（Emitted when several consecutive if statements have identical bodies and thus can be joined by or in their conditions.）

description: Duplicate blocks inside if/elif/else where the condition could be evaluated inside the block to avoid duplication.
code fix example:
for i in range(width // 2):
    print("# " if line % 2 == 0 else " #")
Edulint:
R6501 The branches of the 'if' statement are identical. Remove the 'if' if it is on purpose, or change the branches if not.(Emitted when all branches of an ‘if’ statement contain identical code.)
R6556 The branches of the 'if' statement are similar. Move the 'if' into the branches, so that it only contains lines 3, 6, but only if the if's body has no effect on the condition's value.（Emitted when an ‘if’ statement wraps too long part of a block (similar to identical-if-branches-part, but this one can suggest moving if into a for loop, for example).）
R6559 The branches of the 'if' statement are similar. Use helper variables to store the values that differ between the branches, or create a helper function.（Emitted when the duplication between if statement’s branches can be avoided using helper variables or functions.）

description: A condition executes a long code block in the positive branch and a short one in the negative branch.
Edulint: R6616 Use early return（Emitted when a long block of code is followed by an else that just returns, breaks or continues.）

description: Redundant use of else after return/break/continue.
Pylint:
R1705: Unnecessary "else" after "return", remove the "else" and de-indent the code inside it (no-else-return)（Used in order to highlight an unnecessary block of code following an if, or a try/except containing a return statement. As such, it will warn when it encounters an else following a chain of ifs, all of them containing a return statement.）
R1723: Unnecessary "else" after "break", remove the "else" and de-indent the code inside it (no-else-break)（Used in order to highlight an unnecessary block of code following an if containing a break statement. As such, it will warn when it encounters an else following a chain of ifs, all of them containing a break statement.）
R1724: Unnecessary "else" after "continue", remove the "else" and de-indent the code inside it (no-else-continue)（Used in order to highlight an unnecessary block of code following an if containing a continue statement. As such, it will warn when it encounters an else following a chain of ifs, all of them containing a continue statement.）
Flake8: WPS503 Found useless returning `else` statement（Forbid useless else cases in returning functions. We check single if, for, while, and try statements that all contain return, raise, continue, or break statements with this rule.）
Edulint:
R1705 Unnecessary "else" after "return", remove the "else" and de-indent the code inside it [default]
R1723 Unnecessary "else" after "break", remove the "else" and de-indent the code inside it [default]

description: A variable update expressible as an augmented assignment.
Edulint: R6609 Use augmented assignment: 'XXX' [default]（Emitted when an assignment can be simplified by using its augmented version.）

description: A module that is imported but unused.
Pylint: W0611: Unused XXX imported (unused-import)（Used when an imported module or variable is not used.）
Flake8: F401 'XXX' imported but unused（A module has been imported but is not used anywhere in the file. The module should either be used or the import should be removed.）
Edulint: F401 'XXX' imported but unused [default]

description: The code uses unnecessary plus or double negation.
code example:
profit = +3.33
profit = ---3.33
number = ~~42
bar = not not foo
Flake8:
WPS330 Found unnecessary operator(Forbid unnecessary operators in your code. You can write: 5.4 and +5.4. There’s no need to use the second version. Similarly --5.4, ---5.4, not not foo, and ~~42 contain unnecessary operators.)
SIM208 Use 'foo' instead of 'not (not foo)'
Edulint: WPS330 Found unnecessary operator: 3.33

description: Identity operation or constant-valued expression.
Flake8: WPS345 Found meaningless number operation
Edulint: R6608 Redundant arithmetic(Emitted when there is redundant arithmetic (e.g. +0, *1) in an expression.)

description: Parentheses used unnecessarily in a single item condition.
Pylint: C0325: Unnecessary parens after 'XX' keyword (superfluous-parens)（Used when a single item in parentheses follows an if, for, or other keyword.）
Edulint: C0325 Unnecessary parens after 'XX' keyword [enhancement]

description: The code contains trivial comment directly corresponding to the statement.
The code contains two variables/attributes, where one can be cheaply computed from the other.
There is a condition in the code that can be removed, because a following loop would perform no iteration and return the same result.
code fix example:
sum = 0
for i in range(len(lst)):
# body
return sum

description: The code frequently tests for membership in a list, which could just as well be a set.
Pylint: R6201: Consider using set for membership test (use-set-for-membership)（Membership tests are more efficient when performed on a lookup optimized datatype like ``sets``.）

description: Repeated use of the same arithmetic operation over the same expression.
Edulint: R6607 Use exponentiation instead of repeated muliplication in X * X * X. [enhancement]（Emitted when the code contains repeated adition/multiplication instead of multiplication/exponentiation.）

defect name: Local Variable Used Only to Return
description: A local variable is used only in a return statement.
Flake8: WPS331 Found variables that are only used for `return`: result（Forbid local variables that are only used in return statements. We also allow cases when a variable is assigned, then there are some other statements without direct variable access and the variable is returned. We reserve this use-case to be able to do some extra work before the function returns. We also allow the return of partial, sorted, or modified tuple items that are defined just above.）
Edulint: WPS331 Found variables that are only used for `return`: result

description: A class, function, or method does not have a docstring.
code fix example:
class Person:
    """Class representing a person."""

    def __init__(self, first_name, last_name):
        """
        Initialize a Person instance.

        Args:
            first_name (str): The person's first name.
            last_name (str): The person's last name.
        """
        self.first_name = first_name
        self.last_name = last_name
Pylint:
C0116: Missing function or method docstring (missing-function-docstring)（Used when a function or method has no docstring. Some special methods like __init__ do not require a docstring.）
C0115: Missing class docstring (missing-class-docstring)（Used when a class has no docstring. Even an empty class must have a docstring.）
Flake8:
D101 Missing docstring in public class
D102 Missing docstring in public method
D103 Missing docstring in public function

defect name: Missing Type Annotation in Annotated Code
description: A function or attribute misses a type annotation in code that uses them.
code example:
def inc(x):  # Error: Function is missing a type annotation
    return x + 1
code fix example:
def inc_ok(x: int) -> int: 
    return x + 1

description: The code explicitly calls a double-underscore method instead of using the standard approach.
Pylint: C2801: Unnecessarily calls dunder method_ XXX_. Use * operator. (unnecessary-dunder-call)（Used when a dunder method is manually called instead of using the corresponding function/method/operator.）
Flake8: WPS609 Found direct magic attribute usage: _XXX_（Forbid directly calling certain magic attributes and methods.）
Edulint: WPS609 Found direct magic attribute usage: __XXX__

description: The code sometimes returns a value explicitly and sometimes returns implicit None.
Pylint: R1710: Either all return statements in a function should return an expression, or none of them should. (inconsistent-return-statements)(According to PEP8, if any return statement returns an expression, any return statements where no value is returned should explicitly state this as return None, and an explicit return statement should be present at the end of the function (if reachable))
Edulint:
R1710 Either all return statements in a function should return an expression, or none of them should. [python-specific]
R6206 Both branches should return a value explicitly (one returns implicit None) [default]

description: A redundant pass statement in function bodies.
Pylint: W0107: Unnecessary pass statement (unnecessary-pass)（Used when a "pass" statement can be removed without affecting the behaviour of the code.）
Edulint: W0107 Unnecessary pass statement [default]

description: Boolean expression with unnecessary negation.
Pylint: C0117 Consider changing "not X <**" to "X >= **" (Used when a boolean expression contains an unneeded negation, e.g. when two negation operators cancel each other out.)
Flake8: WPS508 Found incorrect `not` with compare usage（Forbid not with compare expressions.）
Edulint:
C0117 Consider changing  "not X <**" to "X >= **" [default]
WPS508 Found incorrect `not` with compare usage

description: Emptiness of a container is tested by comparing its size to zero instead of the pythonic way of converting the container itself to bool.
Pylint: C1805: "len(lst) == 0" can be simplified to "not len(lst)", if it is strictly an int, as 0 is falsey (use-implicit-booleaness-not-comparison-to-zero)
Flake8: WPS507 Found useless `len()` compare(Forbid unpythonic zero-length compare.Python’s structures like dicts, lists, sets, and tuples all have __bool__ method to checks their length. So, there’s no point in wrapping them into len(...) and checking that it is bigger that 0 or less then 1, etc.)
Edulint: WPS507 Found useless `len()` compare

description: The control variable of a loop is unused in its body.
Flake8: B007 Loop control variable 'i' not used within the loop body. If this is intended, start the name with an underscore.(Checks for unused variables in loops (e.g., for and while statements).)

description: Violating PEP 8 conventions about whitespace, trailing spaces / lines, inconsitent line endings ...
Pylint:
C0303: Trailing whitespace (trailing-whitespace)（Used when there is whitespace between the end of a line and the newline.）
C0304: Final newline missing (missing-final-newline)（Used when the last line in a file is missing a newline.）
C0305: Trailing newlines (trailing-newlines)（Used when there are trailing blank lines in a file.）
Flake8:
W291 trailing whitespace（There should be no whitespace after the final character in a line.）
W292 no newline at end of file（Files should end with a newline.）
W293 blank line contains whitespace（Blank lines should not contain any tabs or spaces.）
W391 blank line at end of file（There should be one, and only one, blank line at the end of each file. This warning will occur when there are zero, two, or more than two blank lines.）
Edulint:
W291 trailing whitespace [default]
W292 no newline at end of file [default]
W293 blank line contains whitespace [default]
W391 blank line at end of file [default]

description: The code contains an if statement with an else branch, whose condition is negated.
Flake8: WPS504 Found negated condition（Forbid negated conditions together with else clause. Move actions from the negated if condition to the else condition）
Edulint: WPS504 Found negated condition

defect name: Argument Does Not Come First in Comparison
description: A code uses a comparison where a constant comes first and a variable only second.
Flake8: WPS309 Found reversed compare order（Forbid comparisons where the argument doesn’t come first.Refactor your comparison expression, place the argument first.）
Edulint: WPS309 Found reversed compare order

description: Using float division and immediately converting the result to int.
Edulint: R6602 Use integral division ( Emitted when the code uses float division and converts the result to int.)

description: The comprehension does not change the structure and there are better ways to copy a structure.
Pylint: R1721: Unnecessary use of a comprehension, use list(numbers) instead. (unnecessary-comprehension)（Instead of using an identity comprehension, consider using the list, dict or set constructor. It is faster and simpler）
Flake8: C416 Unnecessary list comprehension - rewrite using list().（It’s unnecessary to use a dict/list/set comprehension to build a data structure if the elements are unchanged. Wrap the iterable with dict(), list(), or set() instead.）
Edulint: R1721 Unnecessary use of a comprehension, use list(numbers) instead. [python-specific]

description: The code compares types instead of using isinstance.
Pylint: C0123: Use isinstance() rather than type() for a typecheck. (unidiomatic-typecheck)（The idiomatic way to perform an explicit typecheck in Python is to use isinstance(x, Y) rather than type(x) == Y, type(x) is Y. Though there are unusual situations where these give different results.）
Flake8: E721 do not compare types, for exact checks use `is` / `is not`, for instance checks use `isinstance()`（A object should be be compared to a type by using isinstance. This is because isinstance can handle subclasses as well.）
Edulint:
C0123 Use isinstance() rather than type() for a typecheck. [python-specific]
E721 do not compare types, for exact checks use `is` / `is not`, for instance checks use `isinstance()` [default]

description: Emptiness of a container is tested by getting its length and implicitly converting it to bool.
code fix example:
if len(lst) == 0: / if not lst:
    # body
Pylint: C1802: Do not use `len(SEQUENCE)` without comparison to determine if a sequence is empty (use-implicit-booleaness-not-len)（Empty sequences are considered false in a boolean context. You can either remove the call to 'len' (`if not x) or compare the length against a scalar (if len(x) > 1).）

description: Importing other modules from other place then the top level.
Pylint: C0415: Import outside toplevel (math) (import-outside-toplevel)（Used when an import statement is used anywhere other than the module toplevel. Move this import to the top of the file.）
Flake8: WPS433 Found nested import（Forbid imports nested in functions.）
Edulint: C0415 Import outside toplevel (math) [default]

description: The code extends list by a single argument instead of appending it.
Edulint: R6601 Use XX.append(*) instead of XXX. [default](Emitted when code extends list by a single argument instead of appending it.)

description: using %, +, join or format
code example:
from string import Template

menu = ("eggs", "spam", 42.4)

old_order = "%s and %s: %.2f ¤" % menu  # [consider-using-f-string]
beginner_order = menu[0] + " and " + menu[1] + ": " + str(menu[2]) + " ¤"
joined_order = " and ".join(menu[:2])
# +1: [consider-using-f-string]
format_order = "{} and {}: {:0.2f} ¤".format(menu[0], menu[1], menu[2])
# +1: [consider-using-f-string]
named_format_order = "{eggs} and {spam}: {price:0.2f} ¤".format(
    eggs=menu[0], spam=menu[1], price=menu[2]
)
template_order = Template("$eggs and $spam: $price ¤").substitute(
    eggs=menu[0], spam=menu[1], price=menu[2]
)
Pylint: C0209: Formatting a regular string which could be an f-string (consider-using-f-string)（Used when we detect a string that is being formatted with format() or % which could potentially be an f-string. The use of f-strings is preferred. Requires Python 3.6 and ``py-version >= 3.6``.）
Edulint: C0209 Formatting a regular string which could be an f-string [python-specific]

description: The code explicitly states implicit bounds on list slices.
Flake8: WPS349 Found redundant subscript slice（Forbid redundant components in a subscript’s slice.）
Edulint: WPS349 Found redundant subscript slice

description: Comparisons to singletons like None should always be done with is, not using the equality operators.
Pylint: C0121: Comparison 'value == None' should be 'value is None' (singleton-comparison)（Used when an expression is compared to singleton values like True, False or None.）
Flake8: E711 comparison to None should be 'if cond is None:'（Comparisons to the singleton objects, like True, False, and None, should be done with identity, not equality. Use “is” or “is not”）
Edulint: E711 comparison to None should be 'if cond is None:' [default]

description: Compound condition equivalent to a single condition with absolute value.
Edulint: R6211 'x < * and x > -*' can be replaced with 'abs(x) < * (Emitted when there is a problem like x < 4 and x > -4 and suggests abs(x) < 4.)'

description: The code uses an if statement to determine a maximum/minimum of two values, instead of function max/min.
Pylint:
R1731: Consider using 'value1 = max(value1, value2)' instead of unnecessary if block (consider-using-max-builtin)（Using the max builtin instead of a conditional improves readability and conciseness.）
R1730: Consider using 'value1 = min(value1, value2)' instead of unnecessary if block (consider-using-min-builtin)（Using the min builtin instead of a conditional improves readability and conciseness.）
Edulint:
R1731 Consider using 'value1 = max(value1, value2)' instead of unnecessary if block [enhancement]
R1730 Consider using 'value1 = min(value1, value2)' instead of unnecessary if block [enhancement]

description: Iterating through dictionary keys, accessing (not modifying) items at the current key only.
code example:
for key in dictionary:
    print(key, dictionary[key])
code fix example:
for key, val in dictionary.items():
    print(key, val)
Flake8: WPS528 Found implicit `.items()` usage

description: A typecast to the current type is a redundant operation
a return value that is not needed by the caller
code example:
def swap(values):
    temp = values[0]
    values[0] = values[1]
    values[1] = temp
    return temp
code fix example:
def swap(values):
    temp = values[0]
    values[0] = values[1]
    values[1] = temp

defect name: Excessive use of variables or data structures to store intermediate values
description: the use ofunnecessary variables to store intermediate results
code example:
condAux = cond1 and cond2
condRes = condAux and cond3
code fix example: condRes = cond1 and cond2 and cond3

defect name: Redundant check of a condition (part of a composite condition)
description: the value of some conditions in a complex Boolean expression may be already known for a given execution flow, hence such conditions can be removed
Edulint: R6212 'num > 0 and num > 0' can be simplified to 'num > 0'. Simplify the condition if it is on purpose, or change it if it was not. ("redundant-compare-in-condition",Emitted when there is a problem like x > 4 or x > 3 and suggests x > 3. (ie min{4, 3}))

defect name: While Condition Tested Again in the Middle of Its Block
description: A while condition tested again in the middle of its block
code fix example:
varCond = ...  # setting initial value
while varCond != 0:
    # code performing some function
    varCond = ...  # getting new value

defect name: Multiple Distinct Loops That Operate Over the Same Data
description: multiple for loops with the same iteration range that could be merged into a single loop
code fix example:
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

# Merge all operations into a single loop
for num in numbers:
    print(f"Square of {num}: {num ** 2}, Cube: {num ** 3}, Double: {num * 2}")

defect name: Special Treatment of Boundary Case(s) Inside Loop Body
description: some special treatment of a boundary case within the loop
code fix example:
print("{", end="")

for i in range(len(testArray) - 1):  
    print(testArray[i], end=", ")

print(testArray[-1], end="]")

defect name: Statement Inside Loop Only Needed in Last Iteration
description: a statement within a loop that is only executed in the last iteration
code example:
for iter in lst:
    var1 += 1
    var2 += iter
    var3 = var2 / var1
code fix example:
for iter in lst:
    var1 += 1
    var2 += iter
var3 = var2 / var1

defect name: Single-Iteration While Loop Used Instead of if
description: A single-iteration while loop used instead of an ifconditional
code fix example:
if num1 + num2 < 9:
    print(num1 + num2, "has more than 1 digit.")

defect name: Use of Recursion Instead of a Simple Iteration
description: the use of recursion when an iteration would be a simpler solution
Infinite loops with a break to terminate the loop should be replaced with a loop using an explicit end condition

defect name: User-Defined Functions Doing Essentially the Same Work
description:
multiple functions that perform almost
identical tasks
code fix example:
def print_location(city, lat_long, deg, min, sec):
    print(f"The {lat_long} of {city} is {deg}:{min}:{sec}")

description: the functions may be casually spread over the code
code example:
var1 = input()

def func1():
    ...
var2 = input()
var3 = func1(var1, var2)

def func2():
    ...
var4 = func2(var3, var1)
var5 = input()
code fix example:
def func1():
    ...
    
def func2():
    ...

var1 = input()
var2 = input()
var3 = func1(var1, var2)
var4 = func2(var3, var1)
var5 = input()

defect name: Inconsistent Order of the Same Parameters in Different Methods
description:
the order of parameters in the method signatures may
be inconsistent
